info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Marlboro County through 815 PM EDT... At 745 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chavistown, or 7 miles east of Cheraw, moving northeast at 30 mph. Another storm was affecting Bennettsville. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bennettsville, Mccoll, Chavistown, Wallace and Tatum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
